part1.title: Introduction & Interview
part1.description: Questions about familiar topics and personal experiences

questions.question: Can you tell me your name and where you're from?
Do you work or are you a student?
What do you like most about your job/studies?
Can you describe the place where you live?
What do you like about your neighborhood?
What do you like to do in your free time?
Do you prefer indoor or outdoor activities? Why?
What's your favorite type of food?
Do you like cooking? Why or why not?
How do you usually travel to work or school?
What's the weather like in your country?
How often do you use social media?
Do you enjoy shopping? What do you like to buy?
What kind of music do you like listening to?
Do you play any sports? Which ones?

part2.title: Individual Long Turn
part2.description: Describe a topic using provided cue card

questions.question: Describe a person who has influenced you in your life

points: What they have done to influence you
And explain why this person is important to you

questions.question: Describe a place you would like to visit

points: What you know about this place
And explain why you want to visit this place

questions.question: Describe a memorable experience from your childhood

points: And explain why this experience was memorable

questions.question: Describe something you own that is important to you

points: How long you have had it
And explain why it is important to you

questions.question: Describe a celebration or festival in your country

points: What people do during this celebration
And explain why this celebration is important

questions.question: Describe a hobby or activity you enjoy doing

points: And explain why you enjoy this activity

questions.question: Describe an achievement you are proud of

points: And explain why you are proud of this achievement

questions.question: Describe a positive change in your life

points: And explain how this change affected you

questions.question: Describe a skill you would like to learn

points: Why you want to learn it
How you plan to learn it
And explain how this skill would benefit you

questions.question: Describe a book that made an impact on you

points: Why you chose to read it
And explain how it impacted you

part3.title: Two-way Discussion
part3.description: Abstract discussion related to Part 2 topic

questions.question: How has education changed in your country over the past few decades?
What impact has technology had on the way people communicate?
Do you think people are more or less social than they were in the past?
What are the most serious environmental problems in your country?
How do you think the nature of work will change in the future?
How important is it to preserve traditional culture in modern society?
What are the advantages and disadvantages of globalization?
How has people's lifestyle changed compared to previous generations?
What role does media play in shaping public opinion?
How can governments encourage people to lead healthier lifestyles?
How has tourism affected your country?
How have family structures changed in modern society?
What are the main challenges facing cities in the 21st century?
What drives innovation in different industries?
What qualities make a good leader in today's world?

initial: Hello, my name is IELTS Assistant. Today I'll be conducting your IELTS Speaking test.
Good morning/afternoon. I'm your IELTS examiner for today's speaking assessment.
Welcome to your IELTS Speaking test. I'm here to help you demonstrate your English speaking abilities.

transitions.part1ToPart2: Now I'm going to give you a topic and I'd like you to talk about it for 2 minutes. You'll have 1 minute to think about what you're going to say.
transitions.part2ToPart3: Thank you. Now let's discuss some more abstract ideas related to this topic.

conclusion: Thank you. That concludes your IELTS Speaking test today.
That's the end of the speaking test. Thank you for your participation.
Well done. Your IELTS Speaking assessment is now complete.
